statements: Policing should be guided by the shared goals of preventing harm and upholding constitutional rights, recognizing that communities want both safety and fair treatment. A balanced approach combines evidence-based deployment and problem-solving with strong accountability—clear use-of-force standards, transparent data, independent oversight, and effective training in de-escalation and bias reduction. Ongoing community partnership and regular evaluation of outcomes can help ensure strategies reduce crime while also building trust and protecting civil liberties.
